definition: to run off in a great panic (idiom)

sentences.english: The teacher's question caught him flat-footed.
sentences.chinese: 老师的讯问使他仓皇失措。

sentences.english: I would like to know that those who fled south, the birds who actually took the yearning.
sentences.chinese: 我想知道，那些仓皇南飞的鸟群究竟带走了谁的思念。

sentences.english: The crowd in a panic fled in all directions.
sentences.chinese: 仓皇的人群向四面逃去。

sentences.english: These words seems so lonely, like those roaming dogs in streets.
sentences.chinese: 它们那么寥落，象是仓皇街上的流浪狗。

sentences.english: Brand fled and left who actually took away the remembrance.
sentences.chinese: 那些仓皇飞走的鸟群究竟带走了谁的思念。

sentences.english: There is no need to rush at finishing the job. It can wait till tomorrow.
sentences.chinese: 无需仓皇地完成这项工作，能够比及明天完成。

sentences.english: The poacher beat a hasty retreat when he saw the police coming.
sentences.chinese: 猎者见有警察来到立刻仓皇逃走。

sentences.english: West chicken wake up, blind now faces to the south west chicken, haste to escape.
sentences.chinese: 西凤醒来，向南盲目无颜面临西凤，仓皇逃脱。

sentences.english: Peter hurried to go to the post office.
sentences.chinese: 彼得仓皇忙忙盗焓荥局去。

sentences.english: The explanation provided discomposure , stories, allusions, syntax and so on.
sentences.chinese: 提供神色仓皇的解释，故事，典故，造句等内容。

sentences.english: He fled in panic, all the way Elegy.
The enemy's retreat left marks of haste.
sentences.chinese: 敌军留下了仓皇退却的痕迹。

sentences.english: In some cases, this behavior can be disconcerting to the user.
sentences.chinese: 在某些情况下，此项行为会让使用者仓皇失措。

sentences.english: Play not finish, uncle fidgeting, cut exclusionary.
sentences.chinese: 戏未演完，叔父坐立不安，仓皇退席。

sentences.english: The three of us tumbled backward out the doorway.
sentences.chinese: 我们三个人仓皇地从门口退了出来。

definition: variant of 倉皇|仓皇[cang1 huang2]
to run away/to flee in disarray
to lose one's head out of fear (idiom)
to flee in disorder/to scurry off
see 驚慌失措|惊慌失措[jing1 huang1 shi1 cuo4]
to flee in disorder/defeated and in rout
to run away/to go into exile
battered and exhausted/stuck in a dilemma
to flee/to go into exile (from prison)
